𓊶 𓊪 𓏏 𓊮 | Kyphi™ | Kaffee ⇔ Kyphi was a compound 𓊸 incense used for religious and medical purposes. / κυ̑φι for Ancient Egyptian "kap-t", incense, from "kap", to perfume, to cense, to heat, to burn, to ignite. The word root also exists in Indo-European languages, with a similar meaning, like in Sanskrit कपि (kapi) "incense", Greek καπνός "smoke"
